alert.note: Alert for Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 3:29PM EDT until July 07 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTH CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTY... At 329 PM EDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported flash flooding and road closures on the Military Turnpike, Duley Road and Miner Farm Road in the Town of Altona. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, secondary roads is ongoing, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Altona, Champlain, Miner Lake State Park, Sciota, Irona and Alder Bend. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
